p: A person was considered to have an inapparent (subclinical) dengue infection when their serum sample tested positive for IgM antibody to any dengue serotype without an accompanying febrile illness or school-absence identified during the active surveillance period or if the cohort participant seroconverted in the annual follow-up samples. Clinical definitions of serologically or virologically confirmed dengue infection were based on evidence of acute dengue infection, as described below.
